intro.description: The goal of the Incidence Management and Resolution process is to restore normal service operation as quickly as possible and minimize the adverse impact on business operations, thus ensuring that the best possible levels of service quality and availability are maintained.

item.title: IMRP.A1 - Incidence identification
item.description: This activity will initiate the log of each incidence. This incidence could be detected from the Technical team or from the communication mechanism with the customer. It could convenient to detect potential incidence before receiving an incidence from the customer.

item.title: IMRP.A2 - Incidence logging
item.description: This activity will start completing the log of the incidence. Completing the first data such as: date/time, Name/ID of the person and/or group recording the incidence, Method of notification (telephone, automatic, e-mail, in person, etc.), Name/department/phone/location of user and call-back method.

item.title: IMRP.A3 - Incidence categorization
item.description: The objective of this activity is to classify the incidence according to the incidence model. This classification will indicate if the problem is a functional, infrastructural, report, installation and so on.

item.title: IMRP.A4 - Initial diagnosis
item.description: The objective of this activity is to investigate the cause of the incidence with the information provided by previous activity and based on this investigation, to provide a proposal for a first initial solution if possible or define who should solve the incidence.

item.title: IMRP.A5 - Incidence prioritization
item.description: In order to prioritize the incidences it is required to take into account both the urgency of the incidence (how quickly the business needs a resolution) and the level of impact it is causing. Factors that should take into account for determining the impact: 1.- The number of services affected – may be multiple services, 2.- The level of financial losses. 3.- Effect on business reputation. 4.- Regulatory or legislative breaches. It should be noted that an incidence´s priority may be dynamic – if circumstances change, or if an incidence is not resolved within SLA target times, then the priority must be altered to reflect the new situation.

item.title: IMRP.A6- Incidence escalation
item.description: If according to the SLA and the prioritization is appropriate escalate the incidence. The escalation of the incidence could be of two types: a) Functional escalation the incidence will need deeper technical knowledge, the incidence must be immediately escalated to the appropriate level support group. b) Hierarchic escalation: If incidence is of a serious nature (for example urgent and with great impact) the appropriate Software Analyst must be notified, for informational purposes at least. Hierarchic escalation is also used if the activities IMPR.A7- Investigation and Diagnosis and IMPR. A8- Resolution and Recovery are taking too long or proving too difficult.

item.title: IMRP.A7- Investigation and diagnosis
item.description: This activity consists of the following of actions: 1 .- Establish exactly what has gone wrong or being sought by the user . 2.- Understand the chronological order of events. 3.-Confirm the full impact of the incident, including the number and range of users affected. 4.- Identify any events that could have triggered the incident. 5.- Look for previous occurrences by searching previous Incidence logs.

item.title: IMRP.A8- Resolution and Recovery
item.description: The objective of this activity is to find the solution to the incidence, when a potential resolution has been identified, this should be applied and tested. Even when a resolution has been found, sufficient testing must be performed to ensure that recovery action is complete and that the service has been fully restored to the user(s).

item.title: IMRP.A9- Following up the incidence
item.description: The objective of this activity is to be able to know in any moment the status of one incidence. For doing this, the actions to do are: a) to check the progress of the actions defined to solve the incidence, b) to collect information of the incidence management process , c) to communicate if some problems on the resolution to the part affected
